subject: DPS310 temperature pressure, SI7020 temperature
commitMessage:
DPS310 temperature pressure, SI7020 temperature

Infineon DPS310 pressure and temperature sensors for the Blyth
and Storm King Panel, as well as the Silicon Laboratories
SI7020 type sensors.  This provide OpenBMC with the ability
to have the DPS310 pressure and temperature sensors also the
Silicon Laboratories SI7020 type sensors provide OpenBMC
with temperature sensor on dbus via dbus-sensors through
HwmonTempSensor.  And adds "pressure" as a type of sensor.
Changed sensorScaleFactor to have offsetValue and scaleValue
for _raw IIO devices, scaleValue is a multiplier where
sensorScaleFactor was a divisor.  Pulling this into HwmonTempSensor
came about from this Discord discussion:
https://discord.com/channels/775381525260664832/775381525260664836/869641817220595772

Tested: on Rainier's Blyth and Everest's Storm King Op Panels
busctl tree --no-pager xyz.openbmc_project.HwmonTempSensor
busctl introspect --no-pager xyz.openbmc_project.HwmonTempSensor \
/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/Ambient_0_Temp
busctl introspect --no-pager xyz.openbmc_project.HwmonTempSensor \
/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/Ambient_1_Temp
busctl introspect --no-pager xyz.openbmc_project.HwmonTempSensor \
/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/Ambient_2_Temp
busctl introspect --no-pager xyz.openbmc_project.HwmonTempSensor \
/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/PCIE_0_Temp
busctl introspect --no-pager xyz.openbmc_project.HwmonTempSensor \
/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/PCIE_1_Temp
busctl introspect --no-pager xyz.openbmc_project.HwmonTempSensor \
/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/pressure/Station_Pressure
Results consistent with location of the systems.

Signed-off-by: Bruce Mitchell <bruce.mitchell@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I5c0d56b486a671ee507c7bfe18fea72e7eaf9ebe

Patch Set 34: Code-Review+1

Thank you for addressing my review comments.  I still think the createSensors() function would benefit from refactoring into several smaller functions.  However, I understand that the function was very long before this commit.

I tried to review the base C++ involved in this commit.  I'll need to rely on others with more knowledge of iio and the dbus-sensors repo to review those aspects.

(2 comments)

Couple minor things, Another thing is that the file and class name hwmon temp sensor is bit misleading with this addition. Maybe a follow up patch can be used to rename to something better.

Patch Set 104:

The last non-rebase patchset to this was 5 weeks ago.  When can we expect the next round of cleanups?  I'd like to see this merged so we can continue the discussion on non-pressure IIO devices, but can't until the implementation gets cleaned up.

Patch Set 104:

> Patch Set 104:
> 
> The last non-rebase patchset to this was 5 weeks ago.  When can we expect the next round of cleanups?  I'd like to see this merged so we can continue the discussion on non-pressure IIO devices, but can't until the implementation gets cleaned up.

I expect to be able to spend time on this after the first week of November.

Patch Set 104:

> Patch Set 104:
> 
> > Patch Set 104:
> > 
> > The last non-rebase patchset to this was 5 weeks ago.  When can we expect the next round of cleanups?  I'd like to see this merged so we can continue the discussion on non-pressure IIO devices, but can't until the implementation gets cleaned up.
> 
> I expect to be able to spend time on this after the first week of November.

excellent.  Thanks for the update.

Patch Set 104:

(1 comment)

Temperature and Pressure sensor shouldn't share the same threshold setting

Patch Set 104:

> Patch Set 104:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Temperature and Pressure sensor shouldn't share the same threshold setting

Actually pressure shouldn't have a threshold at all.  Altitude which is computed from pressure is where the threshold is and that is here:
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/44526/4/meta-ibm/recipes-phosphor/sensors/phosphor-virtual-sensor/p10bmc/virtual_sensor_config.json#39

Patch Set 104:

> Patch Set 104:
> 
> > Patch Set 104:
> > 
> > (1 comment)
> > 
> > Temperature and Pressure sensor shouldn't share the same threshold setting
> 
> Actually pressure shouldn't have a threshold at all.  Altitude which is computed from pressure is where the threshold is and that is here:
> https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/44526/4/meta-ibm/recipes-phosphor/sensors/phosphor-virtual-sensor/p10bmc/virtual_sensor_config.json#39

It sound like that your pressure reading is only used to calculate the altitude.
However, I don't think we should ignore the basic feature for a sensor, no matter what the usage will be.
Even if I want to set a threshold for DSP310 temperature only, it also will be shared to pressure sensor, this shouldn't be.
It is also common to have threshold setting for a temperature sensor.

45423: Change fanName to sensorName as this is a sensor
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/45423
Why are we removing this chunk and lines 271-287? This seems like we are removing support for multi-temperature devices?

Because our sensors only have 1 temperature per device,
yet some of our devices have multiple different sensors
that need supporting.  This code seems to break the
support for having temperature and pressure sensors
within the DPS310.

Also this follow what was working and done for
43410: dbus-sensors: Support DPS310 and SI7020
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/43410
I think it would nicer to have the case for a temperature sensor as the default and the pressure case in the if statement - as the pressure sensor is the exception / in the minority.
maybe remove this since it will always be overridden anyway?
Just to make it clear, maybe add that the SI7020 is the only supported IIO device right now, so the only device that will use _raw

There are multi-temperature devices that also use NameX, which was what for loop on line 255 in the previous code was doing.  We have some TMP423s in our current systems that you could make a config for and test that you can get them all to show up OK.
This also presumably adds "pressure" as a type of sensor?

Temperature and Pressure sensor shared the same threshold setting but they had different unit.
We should read individual threshold settings here for each type of sensor from entity-manager configuration.
For example: we had Name and Name1 labels in EM configuration for DPS310 device, so there should be 2 set of thresholds for them. One for temperature, another for pressure.

Hi Bruce,

Referring to your comment here: https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/45406/102/include/HwmonTempSensor.hpp#38

You'll also need to delete these. From the colon to the curly brace is an initialisation list for the members inside HwmonTempSensor. So `waitTimer(io)` assigns what is in `io` to the class member `waitTimer`. Since you've deleted minValue and maxValue from the class members you should also remove them from this list.
Like Ed I dislike the ternary operator, but to me this whole declaration is far harder to read and understand.  But it is done.

string() returns a value, not a reference, so this reference is pointing at an rvalue, which will be destroyed shortly.

(yes, I realize this is subtle, but unit tests would've caught this).
